keyTakeAways: Lance Bass has type 1.5 diabetes, also known as latent autoimmune diabetes (LADA).
He uses the Dexcom G7 Continuous Glucose Monitoring System to monitor his blood sugar levels.
Bass created an online persona called 'Blood Sugar Lance' to educate people about diabetes with humor, which developed accidentally on Instagram.
He identifies white rice and white bread as foods that significantly spike his blood sugar, even with insulin treatment.
His uncle had type 1 diabetes, which influenced his early awareness of diabetes management.
Advancements in monitoring technology and the supportive diabetic community have made managing diabetes easier for him.
Stress from his busy career and parenting his four-year-old twins, Violet and Alexander, affects his blood sugar levels.
Lance Bass has stated there is no current plan for an *NSYNC reunion tour, and he has expressed skepticism about misleading reports.
He emphasizes that fans should not believe everything they read about potential *NSYNC reunions.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Lance Bass, former member of the boy band *NSYNC, shares insights into his personal journey with type 1.5 diabetes (LADA), emphasizing how continuous glucose monitoring via the Dexcom G7 system has improved his daily management. He created the humorous online persona 'Blood Sugar Lance' on Instagram to educate the public about diabetes in a lighthearted way, highlighting dietary triggers like white rice and white bread that cause dangerous blood sugar spikes. While fans continue to speculate about a *NSYNC reunion, Bass has firmly stated there is no current plan and cautions against believing misinformation. The article underscores how personal health experiences, especially with chronic conditions, can become powerful tools for public education, community building, and emotional resilience—particularly when balanced with family and career demands.
title: Lance Bass has more to say about living with diabetes than he does about an *NSYNC reunion
